title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development 

Act 2000 (Exempted Development) (No. 2) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall be included in the collective citation the 

Planning and Development Regulations 2001 to 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development act 2000 (exempted development) (no 2) regulation 2021 (2) regulation shall included collective citation planning development regulation 2001 2021

title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 2. Schedule 2 of the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 (S.I.
text_raw:
2. Schedule 2 of the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 (S.I. 

No. 600 of 2001) are amended, in Part 1, by – 

(a) 

the substitution of the following text for the text in column (1) 
under the heading Class 29A: 

“Development consisting of – 

(a) 

the construction of a charging point for electric 
vehicles that – 

(i) 

in the case of a charging point situated on a 
public road, does not exceed 0.75 cubic metres 
by volume above ground, and 

(ii) 

in all other cases, does not exceed 3.6 cubic 
metres by volume above ground, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 19th March, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [115] 3 

(b) 

(c) 

the adaptation of a street lighting pole for the 
purposes of the provision of both street lighting and 
a charging point for electric vehicles, 

the adaptation of a car parking payment machine 
situated on a public road for the purpose of both the 
making of payments for car parking and a charging 
point for electric vehicles, or 

(d) 

the construction of bollards not exceeding – 

(i)
text_norm: 2 schedule 2 planning development regulation 2001 (s.i no 600 2001) amended part 1 - (a) substitution following text text column (1) heading class 29a development consisting - (a) construction charging point electric vehicle - (i) case charging point situated public road exceed 0.75 cubic metre volume ground (ii) case exceed 3.6 cubic metre volume ground notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 19th march 2021 115 3 (b) (c) adaptation street lighting pole purpose provision street lighting charging point electric vehicle adaptation car parking payment machine situated public road purpose making payment car parking charging point electric vehicle (d) construction bollard exceeding - (i)

title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 1.2 metres in height, and
text_raw:
1.2 metres in height, and 

(ii) 0.2 cubic metres by volume above ground, 

for the purpose of protecting such charging point, 

provided that such electrical construction or adaptation is 
carried out by a registered electrical contractor within the 
meaning of section 9D of the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 
(No. 23 of 1999).”, 

(b) 

the substitution of the following text for the text in column (2) in 
so far as it relates to Class 29A: 

“Advertising signage or other advertising material shall not be 
affixed to, or placed at, a charging point situated on a public 
road other than for the purpose of – 

(a) 

identifying the charging point, 

(b) providing instructions in relation to fees and to the 

use of the charging point, or 

(c) 

the contact details of 
providing 
manager or owner of the charging point.”, and 

the operator, 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [115] 

(c) 

the insertion of the following after CLASS 29A: 

“ 

CLASS 29B 

Development consisting of – 

(a) 

the construction of a charging hub 
for electric vehicles that contain – 

(i) 

(ii) 

not more than one 
substation or mini pillar to 
which Class 29 applies, and 

not more than 4 charging 
points to which Class 29A 
applies, or 

(b) 

the construction of bollards not 
exceeding – 

(i)

title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 1.2 metres in height, and
text_raw:
1.2 metres in height, and 

(ii) 0.2 cubic metres by volume 

above ground, 

for the purpose of protecting each such 
charging point, provided that such 
electrical construction is carried out by a 
registered electrical contractor within the 
meaning of section 9D of the Electricity 
Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999). 

The development shall be 
situated – 

(a) at a place (other than a 

public road) where parking 
facilities are provided, the 
development of which was 
carried out in accordance 
with the requirements of the 
Planning and Development 
Act 2000 (No. 30 of 2000), 
and 

(b) not closer than 500 metres 

to any charging hub that 
forms part of any other 
development to which Class 
29B applies. 

”. 

GIVEN under my hand, 

16 March, 2021. 

PETER BURKE, 

Minister of State at the Department of Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [115] 5
